metadata.title: Marin_Vicente_et_al_Raw_data_4
metadata.description:
Readme:

Complementary raw data: Distributed in 4 different github links (Raw_data_1-Raw_data_4). Raw data 1 includes as well the SEURAT code adapted to proteomics data used in the manuscript.

 

1.       Supplementary_figure_7 folder: includes the Adobe Illustrator Fig_Suppl_7.ai; the xlsx file with the quantification of the correspondant figures; the jpg files for the correspondant panels of the figure.

2.       Supplementary_figure8_10: includes the Adobe Illustrator Fig_Suppl_8.ai, Fig_Suppl_9.ai and Fig_Supp_10.ai; includes the correspondant txt input files for metaboanalyst, the csv files including the VIP proteins out of the PLSDA analysis; the pdf files of the images of PCA and PLSDA from Supp_Fig_8, the svg files of the string networks from Supp_Fig_9 and the pdf files of panels of Supp_Fig_10.

3.       Supplementary_figure11_13 folder: includes the Adobe Illustrator files for Fig_Suppl_11.ai, Fig_Suppl_12.ai and Fig_Suppl_13.ai; includes the input xlsx and csv files raw information for the indicated sections.

4.       Table_S1: including the histone proteins included in the chromatin category.

metadata.title: D9.4: Report on carbon estimates driven by SR-ESM output
metadata.description:
About this document

The report presents a map of the carbon fluxes over Europe as derived from an offline simulation of the carbon fluxes driven by the SR-ESM output. 

Work package in charge

WP9

Executive summary

This report presents the deliverable associated with WP9.4, which aimed to quantify the carbon fluxes over Europe, as derived from an offline terrestrial ecosystem simulation, driven by the output of the nextGEMS ICON storm-resolving model, and compare these estimates to estimates obtained from coarse-resolution models. As described in the report, the goal was achieved by comparing the results of two offline terrestrial ecosystem simulations, one driven by the nextGEMS ICON storm-resolving model, and one by a conventional coarse-resolution climate simulation taken from CMIP6. Using storm-resolving atmospheric forcing leads in mean, to a larger gross primary productivity, meaning that the plants are more actively photosynthesizing. We explain this behavior by the fact that more shortwave radiation is available for plants' photosynthesis due to shorter rainfall events in the storm-resolving model. Hence, we were able to show that storm-scale variability affects the carbon budget through its impact on the hydrological cycle, fully achieving project goal vi.

data.title: D9.4: Report on carbon estimates driven by SR-ESM output

metadata.title: "Maria Costea, Relațiile politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare (1938–1940), Cluj-Napoca: Napoca Star, 2010, 476 pp., ISBN 978-606-550-046-4". REVISTA DE ȘTIINȚE POLITICE ȘI RELAȚII INTERNAȚIONALE IX, no. 4/2012,DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.16281626.
metadata.description:
REVISTA DE ȘTIINȚE POLITICE ȘI RELAȚII INTERNAȚIONALE IX, no. 4/2012

Viorica Moisuc, Romanian–Bulgarian Political-Diplomatic Relations (1938–1940) – A Scholarly Review of Maria Costea, Relațiile politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare (1938–1940), Cluj-Napoca: Napoca Star, 2010, 476 pp., ISBN 978-606-550-046-4, DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.16281626.

Review

👤 Author of the Review:

Viorica Moisuc
Academia Română – Institutul de Științe Politice și Relații Internaționale „Ion I. C. Brătianu”

📘 Reviewed Work:

Maria Costea, Relațiile politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare (1938–1940), Cluj-Napoca: Napoca Star, 2010, 476 pp. ISBN: 978-606-550-046-4

📝 Abstract / Description (Bilingual):

Română:
Lucrarea Mariei Costea analizează în profunzime relațiile politice și diplomatice româno-bulgare într-o perioadă de criză internațională fără precedent (1938–1940), marcată de Pactul Ribbentrop–Molotov, destrămarea Cehoslovaciei și cedarea Dobrogei de Sud. Recenzia de față, semnată de Viorica Moisuc, evidențiază valoarea documentară și interpretativă a monografiei, relevând contribuția originală a autoarei la istoriografia relațiilor internaționale din Europa de Est. Lucrarea este considerată o referință de prim rang în domeniul istoriei politico-diplomatice.

English:
Maria Costea’s scholarly work offers a detailed investigation into Romanian–Bulgarian political-diplomatic relations during the exceptional geopolitical crisis of 1938–1940. The context includes the Ribbentrop–Molotov Pact, the dismantling of Czechoslovakia, and the cession of Southern Dobruja. This review, written by the prominent Academic Viorica Moisuc, underlines the documentary richness and analytical strength of the monograph and recognizes the author’s original contribution to the historiography of Eastern European international relations. The book stands as a key academic reference in the field of 20th-century diplomacy and border politics.

🔑 Keywords :

Romania, Bulgaria, Dobruja, Treaty of Craiova, World War II diplomacy, geopolitical crisis, revisionism, Ribbentrop–Molotov Pact, Romanian foreign policy, Bulgarian foreign policy, Napoca Star,

 

Maria Costea, Romanian–Bulgarian Political-Diplomatic Relations (1938–1940)
Cluj-Napoca, Napoca Star Publishing House, 2010, 476 pages.

The subject of Maria Costea’s book addresses a theme that has been little or only tangentially examined by Romanian and international historiography, and where numerous errors, subjective interpretations, and scholarly controversies persist in international academic discourse.

In conducting this research, the author demonstrated the utmost rigor in uncovering historical truth, based on archival documents, memoir literature, and Romanian, Bulgarian, and Western historiography, as well as the press of the time. The book originates from Maria Costea’s doctoral thesis, defended at the “Ovidius” University of Constanța (Faculty of History and Political Science), and awarded the highest grade.

From the outset, I emphasize that the work, as a whole, represents an original and valuable contribution to understanding Romanian–Bulgarian political-diplomatic relations during a period of unprecedented European political crisis. Romania remained the only country in Central Europe with its borders intact, despite immense threats emerging from the East, West, and South. During the analyzed period, several major European states disappeared one after another from the map: Austria, Czechoslovakia, Poland, Denmark, Norway, Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, France. On June 22, 1940, France—the principal ally of Romania—was removed from the war, and Britain, in turn, was under threat from the Nazi war machine.

In this precarious international context, when Romania was entirely isolated due to the Ribbentrop–Molotov Pact, its foreign policy attempted a difficult balancing act to delay the revision of its national borders in favor of the USSR, Hungary, and Bulgaria, and to slow the complete economic takeover by the Nazi Reich.

Romanian–Bulgarian political-diplomatic relations evolved along specific lines determined by the territorial changes occurring in Central Europe between 1938–1939. In this evolution, the positions of the USSR and Germany were decisive factors in Bulgaria’s foreign policy. The severing of Southern Dobruja in the summer of 1940 was the direct consequence of the shift in international power following the German–Soviet agreement, which reached its peak in August 1939.

Attention must be drawn to the introductory study of this work, focused on analyzing the Romanian and Bulgarian historiography related to the subject, which constitutes a substantial essay—unusual for doctoral theses—and all the more valuable for it.

The book is structured into twelve chapters, preceded by an “Introduction” and followed by “Conclusions” and “Bibliography.”

The evolution of Romanian–Bulgarian relations is examined with professionalism not only on the political and diplomatic levels but also with respect to cultural, ecclesiastical, and social issues—each of great interest (Chapter I). Step by step, the author presents how Bulgarian revisionism asserted itself more vigorously as a consequence of Yugoslavia’s internal fractures and the weakening of the cohesion of the Balkan Entente following the Anschluss and, most notably, after the disintegration of Czechoslovakia (Chapters II and III). The author introduces numerous previously unknown documents, and her polemical spirit is effectively employed, with strong arguments, whenever erroneous theses appear in Bulgarian historiography.

The influence of the USSR’s aggressive revisionist policy, especially after the signing of the Ribbentrop–Molotov Pact, is revealed in a new and much more complex light through the judicious analysis conducted in Chapters IV and V. Without a doubt, in this complex web of issues, Romania’s foreign policy—still attempting to draw Bulgaria closer to the Balkan Entente, or ultimately into a neutral Balkan bloc—offers new data and insights that enhance our understanding of the matter (Chapter VI).

The direct involvement of the Axis powers and the USSR in supporting Bulgaria’s territorial claims against Romania is presented within the context of wartime events, but also in connection with Hungary’s revisionist ambitions regarding Transylvania (Chapter VII).

Chapters VIII, IX, and X are directly focused on the issue of Romania’s cession of Southern Dobruja, bringing in a wealth of new data and offering a detailed analysis that fully clarifies the final blow dealt to the Romanian unitary state by Bulgaria and its allies. The analysis of the Treaty of Craiova and its implementation (Chapters XI and XII) concludes this valuable doctoral thesis, which presents in its full scope a difficult topic—politically, economically, and strategically intertwined—and one previously understood only superficially and unilaterally.

At the end of these brief observations, I note with satisfaction the realization of a book of indisputable value, one that deserves translation into an international language.

I consider that Maria Costea’s book, entitled Romanian–Bulgarian Political-Diplomatic Relations (1938–1940), fully meets the criteria of a scientifically rigorous academic work. It is a reference book in the field and establishes the author as a distinguished specialist in the history of international relations.

Prof. Dr. Viorica Moisuc

Viorica MOISUC, RECENZIA LA volumul Maria Costea, Relațiile politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare (1938–1940), Cluj-Napoca, Napoca Star, 2010, 476 p.

 

Subiectul cărții Mariei Costea abordează o problematică puțin sau doar tangențial studiată de istoriografia română și internațională, în cadrul căreia persistă numeroase erori, interpretări subiective și controverse științifice în circuitul informațional internațional.

În realizarea acestei cercetări, autoarea dovedește o remarcabilă rigoare științifică în descifrarea adevărului istoric, bazându-se pe documente de arhivă, memorialistică, dar și pe istoriografia română, bulgară și occidentală, precum și pe presa vremii. Cartea are la origine teza de doctorat a Mariei Costea, susținută la Universitatea „Ovidius” din Constanța (Facultatea de Istorie și Științe Politice), evaluată cu calificativul maxim.

Sub aspect general, subliniez că lucrarea reprezintă o contribuție originală și valoroasă la cunoașterea relațiilor politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare într-o perioadă de criză politică europeană fără precedent. România era, în 1939, singura țară din Europa Centrală ale cărei frontiere rămăseseră neatinse, în ciuda presiunilor imense exercitate din Est, Vest și Sud. În perioada analizată, au fost eliminate de pe harta Europei state importante: Austria, Cehoslovacia, Polonia, Danemarca, Norvegia, Belgia, Olanda, Luxemburg, Franța. La 22 iunie 1940, Franța — principalul aliat al României — a ieșit din război, iar Marea Britanie era, la rândul ei, amenințată de ofensiva nazistă.

În acest context internațional extrem de fragil, când România era complet izolată diplomatic ca urmare a Pactului Ribbentrop–Molotov, politica sa externă s-a angajat într-o acțiune echilibrată, menită să tempereze tendințele de revizuire a frontierelor în favoarea URSS, Ungariei și Bulgariei, precum și să întârzie capturarea întregii economii naționale de către Reich-ul nazist.

Relațiile politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare au evoluat pe coordonate specifice, determinate de schimbările teritoriale survenite în Europa Centrală între 1938–1939. Pozițiile URSS și Germaniei au fost decisive în orientarea externă a Bulgariei. Pierderea Dobrogei de Sud, în vara anului 1940, a fost rezultatul modificării raportului internațional de forțe, în urma convenției sovieto-germane, care a atins apogeul în august 1939.

Atrag atenția în mod special asupra studiului introductiv al lucrării, axat pe analiza critică a istoriografiei române și bulgare privitoare la această temă. Acest eseu introductiv are o valoare deosebită, fiind rar întâlnit în lucrările doctorale prin amploarea și densitatea ideilor.

Lucrarea este structurată în XII capitole, precedate de „Introducere” și urmate de „Concluzii” și „Bibliografie”. Evoluția relațiilor româno-bulgare este analizată cu profesionalism nu doar în plan politic și diplomatic, ci și în dimensiunea culturală, religioasă, socială, temele abordate având un interes aparte (cap. I).

Autoarea prezintă cu claritate modul în care revizionismul bulgar a devenit tot mai vizibil în contextul slăbirii coeziunii Înțelegerii Balcanice, al mișcărilor centrifuge din Iugoslavia și, mai ales, după destrămarea Cehoslovaciei și Anschluss-ul Austriei (cap. II și III). Se remarcă introducerea în circuitul științific a numeroase documente inedite, iar atitudinea polemică a autoarei este solid argumentată în fața erorilor perpetuate de istoriografia bulgară.

Influența politicii revizioniste și agresive a URSS, în special după semnarea Pactului Ribbentrop–Molotov, este analizată judicios în capitolele IV și V. În acest context, demersurile externe ale României, care încerca fie atragerea Bulgariei în Înțelegerea Balcanică, fie constituirea unui bloc de state neutre în regiune, aduc în discuție date noi, valoroase (cap. VI).

Implicarea directă a Axei și a URSS în susținerea pretențiilor teritoriale ale Bulgariei față de România este prezentată în corelație cu politica revizionistă maghiară asupra Transilvaniei (cap. VII).

Capitolele VIII, IX și X sunt dedicate cedării Dobrogei de Sud, analizându-se în detaliu cauzele, etapele și consecințele acestui eveniment, iar capitolele XI și XII oferă o examinare profundă a Tratatului de la Craiova și a aplicării acestuia.

Această teză de doctorat reușește să prezinte în mod complet o temă dificilă, marcată de multiple încrengături geopolitice, economice și strategice, care până acum a fost tratată superficial și unilateral.

La finalul acestor considerații, subliniez realizarea unei cărți de o valoare incontestabilă, care ar merita traducerea într-o limbă de circulație internațională.

Lucrarea doamnei Maria Costea, intitulată Relațiile politico-diplomatice româno-bulgare (1938–1940), întrunește toate calitățile unei contribuții științifice de înalt nivel, reprezentând o lucrare de referință în domeniul istoriei relațiilor internaționale și confirmând statutul autoarei ca specialist remarcabil în acest domeniu.

Prof. Dr. Viorica Moisuc

metadata.title: Volcano Plot of Differentially Accumulated Metabolites in Sweet Potato Leaves under Drought Stress
metadata.description:
This dataset supports Figure 6 in the article “Unveiling Stage-Specific Flavonoid Dynamics Underlying Drought Tolerance in Sweet Potato (Ipomoea batatas L.) via Integrative Transcriptomic and Metabolomic Analyses.”

Figure 6 presents volcano plots of differentially accumulated metabolites (DAMs) in sweet potato leaves subjected to drought stress at distinct developmental stages. The figure includes three pairwise comparisons:

  • CK vs. DS1: Drought stress during the branching and tuber formation stage

  • CK vs. DS2: Drought stress during the storage root expansion stage

  • DS1 vs. DS2: Comparison between the two drought stress stages

Each volcano plot highlights metabolites with |log₂ fold change| ≥ 1 and VIP ≥ 1 as significantly up- or down-regulated. Top 5 up- and down-regulated metabolites are annotated by biochemical class. Dashed lines represent the significance thresholds.

The dataset includes:

  • Input Excel files for metabolite comparisons (DAM data)

  • R script for generating volcano plots

  • Final high-resolution figure in PDF format

This module enables full reproduction of Figure 6 and facilitates reuse of metabolomics comparison data under varying drought conditions in sweet potato.

metadata.title: Spatio-Temporal Monitoring of Desertification in Sokoto State Using Remote Sensing and Vegetation Indices
metadata.description: Desertification poses a grave challenge to the environment and socio-economic stability of Northern States in Nigeria. Desertification monitoring was analyzed for Sokoto state with the collection of MOD13Q1(250-m), MYD13Q1 (1-km) and the Vegetation Index Phenology (VIP VIPPHEN NDVI) from NASA. The Vegetation Index and Phenology (VIP) global datasets were created using surface reflectance data from the Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR) from 1981 to 1999 and Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS)/Terra MOD09 surface reflectance data from 2000 to 2014. The Modis MOD13Q1 and MYD13Q1 were used to access the vegetation index (NDVI) and Land surface temperature LST of 2010 to 2020 while the VIP VIPPHEN NDVI was used to access the NDVI of 2000. The LST of 2000 were collected from The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM). The Modis data and the Phenology NDVI were resampled using Landsat L8 path 191 and row 51 of Sokoto state coverage and were re-projected from unknown datum to WGS1984 UTM zone 32N. The vegetation health index (VHI), Vegetation Condition Index (VCI) and the Thermal condition index (TCI) were estimated. TCI for the year 2000 has the highest percentage with 56.94% which falls within the normal range, the severe range has the highest percentage with 64.62% and 59.83% for the year 2010 and 2020 respectively. This result clearly indicates a decrement in the thermal condition between 2010 and 2020. The VCI analysis indicates that severe drought conditions affected the highest proportion of land in 2000 (42.21%,), 2010 (42.88%) and 2020 (42%). In VHI, the abnormal stress has the highest percentage with 56.54% for 2000 while the severe stress with 41.95% and 41.92% for 2010 and 2020 respectively.  The result shows that four regions of the state (Gudu, Isa & Kebbe, Rabah, Tambawal & Tangazar) were the most affected weather for the year with highest or lowest analysis. This research provides the cost-effective means by tracking trends in degradation of land revealing the most severe which is important for the implementation of timely mitigation strategies by sustainable policy makers.

data.title: Spatio-Temporal Monitoring of Desertification in Sokoto State Using Remote Sensing and Vegetation Indices

metadata.title: Optimized Traffic Management System for Emergency and V.I.P Vehicles
metadata.description: Inefficient traffic management poses significant challenges to the timely and safe arrival of ambulances at emergency scenes, impacting patient outcomes and public safety. The existing traffic infrastructure often fails to provide adequate priority to ambulances, resulting in delays, congestion, and increased risk of accidents during emergency responses. In densely populated urban areas, effective traffic management for ambulances is paramount to ensuring timely and efficient emergency medical response. However, existing traffic systems often struggle to accommodate emergency vehicles adequately, leading to delays that can significantly impact patient outcomes. Thus, our traffic management system model is an innovative solution that optimizes traffic flow and prioritize ambulance movement that minimizes response times and enhance emergency medical services.
keywords: Traffic management, VIP vehicles, traffic signal
references: 1.	Haghani, A., Tian, Q., & Hu, H. (2004). Simulation model for real-time emergency vehicle dispatching and routing. Transportation Research Record, 1882(1), 176–183. https://doi.org/10.3141/1882-23.

4.	Chakraborty, P. S., Tiwari, A., & Sinha, P. R. (2015). Adaptive and optimized emergency vehicle dispatching algorithm for intelligent traffic management system. Procedia Computer Science, 57, 1384-1393.
